授業目的:
In this course students will learn the key concepts and frameworks of strategic management and how these concepts can be applied to real business situations. Particularly, the course adopts the perspective of managers within the organizations who devote their significant time in crafting and executing strategies to achieve sustainable performance for their businesses in an increasingly complex and uncertain
business environments.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
a) Understand the basic concepts, frameworks, and practices of strategic management.
b) Enhance their skills of applying theoretical knowledge in real life business settings.
c) Analyze the internal and external environment in which the businesses operate and asses their significance in strategic decisions.
d) Acquaint with the managerial role in defining and executing corporate strategy.
e) Understand the competitive challenges of a global market environment.
f) Understand how and why ethical principles and socially responsible management practices are critical for sustainable growth of the business.
g) Increase their abilities to participate in interactive class environment and work in small teams.
特記事項: 【合併】Management A（国際学部）/Management A（国際学部）

This course will be offered in face-to-face format from the first lecture.
Necessary materials for the class will be available on LUNA.
